definition: in a way that justifies the use of the term/genuine/proper/in a way that conforms to logic/justifiable/appropriate/perfectly legitimate
name/noun (part of speech)/place (e.g. among winners)/famous/classifier for people
first month of the lunar year
straight/upright/proper/main/principal/to correct/to rectify/exactly/just (at that time)/right (in that place)/(math.) positive
words/speech/to say/to talk
to obey/to follow/to arrange/to make reasonable/along/favorable

sentences.english: From now on you are the official Statue of Liberty of this street.
sentences.chinese: 從今以後，你就是這條街上名正言順的自由神像。

sentences.english: Protection for domestic industry is admittedly discriminatory .
sentences.chinese: 保護本國工業是種名正言順的歧視。

sentences.english: In order to be right and proper three guns and bonuses, Chen wants to get married.
sentences.chinese: 爲了更加的名正言順，陳三炮想要和花紅成親。

sentences.english: Even with his hand to be right and proper.
sentences.chinese: 即使不能跟他名正言順的牽着手逛街。

definition: hopelessly muddled/impossible to unravel
to have nothing to say (idiom)
to accept tacitly/acquiescence
use both carrot and stick/use gentle methods and force/an iron hand in a velvet glove
to do whatever one pleases
not to hear, not to question (idiom)/to show no interest in sth/uncritical/not in the least concerned
lit. to push the boat with the current/fig. to take advantage of the situation for one's own benefit
lit. heaven's law and earth's principle (idiom); fig. right and proper/right and unalterable/a matter of course
to conspire
see 未可厚非[wei4 ke3 hou4 fei1]
to see, hear and obey (idiom); to take advice/to take sb at his word
to both be willing/mutual consent
to avoid the important and dwell on the trivial/to keep silent about major charges while admitting minor ones
to look for trouble
to keep on saying (idiom); to repeat over and over again
to oppose each other with equal harshness (idiom); tit for tat/measure for measure
